intro: Sisyrinchium segetum, commonly known as the grain bluebell, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as fields and meadows. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. Sisyrinchium segetum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an ephemeral wildflower.
